resources.string: This powerful melee unit (the Aboriginal replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Javelineer[COLOR_REVERT]) is excellent against melee units and has the ability to withdraw.
This powerful melee unit (the Baktrian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spearman[COLOR_REVERT]) gets a strength increase and has a bonus when attacking cities.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Composite Bowman[COLOR_REVERT] (the Akkadian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Archer[COLOR_REVERT]) start with Shock 1 and get an extra first strike chance.

This powerful Mounted unit (the Batavian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT]) this accustomed to fight in the very swampy regions of their country, so do not get negative when attacking swamp tiles. Furthermore, gets the Amphibious promotion.
This quick mounted unit (the Albanian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT]) gets 1-2 first strikes, along with a chance of withdrawing from battle.
THe Huskarl is the Anglo-Saxon replacement for the Swordsman. It is excellent against archery units.
Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ayastigi[COLOR_REVERT] for quick, early defense for your cities. This unit replaces [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warriors[COLOR_REVERT] and gets an additional bonus in melee combat.
The Apache replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] is slightly more powerful and gets an added bonus against Mounted units.
The Argentinian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] is slightly more powerful and gets an added bonus against Gunpowder units.

This most powerful mounted unit (the Armenian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]) is particularly effective in open terrain and can withdraw from combat. The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fedayee[COLOR_REVERT] also receives the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pinch I[COLOR_REVERT] promotion when built and is able of pillaging enemy territory efficiently.
This powerful mounted unit (the Khazar replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT]) can defend well.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Twafo[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the traditional Arquebusier and has a bonus when defending cities.
This Toltec replacement for the Maceman unit, is rather stronger than usual, and thus their recruitment cost is higher.

This unit (the Latvian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Axeman[COLOR_REVERT]) can defend itself well against [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Melee[COLOR_REVERT] units and is a good defender of cities. Also gets a bonus versus [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chariots[COLOR_REVERT].
Bangladesh's [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sena Bahini[COLOR_REVERT] is cheaper than the traditional [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artillery[COLOR_REVERT] unit, and receives a movement bonus for quick deployment.
The Belgian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] receives an additional bonus against Gunpowder units and a free City Garrison I promotion.
The Bolivarian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] is adept at traversing and defending in hills.
The Brazilian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] is slightly more powerful and less expensive to produce.
This melee unit (the Burmese replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warrior[COLOR_REVERT]) receives bonuses against animals and when defended on hill terrain.

This powerful gundpowder unit (the Swedish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketman[COLOR_REVERT]) is immune to first strikes and receives a free first strike, besides the Drill I promotion. These troops are always trying to take the initiative, preventing the enemy from moving freely on the battlefield. They are able to anticipate enemy strategies, always being the first to cause damage when combat begins.
Chilean [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caribiniers[COLOR_REVERT] (a replacement for [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Machine Guns[COLOR_REVERT]) gain both an additional 25% city defense and 2 additional first strikes.
This Chola replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maceman[COLOR_REVERT] unit receives a +25% city attack and defense bonus.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]AUC[COLOR_REVERT] is the Colombian replacement for [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marine[COLOR_REVERT]. They are excellent at marauding, moving through the jungles with ease.

The Congolese swordsman replacement, the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Fidalgo[COLOR_REVERT], is a bit cheaper and automatically receives the Woodsman I promotion, giving it an additional defensive bonus in jungles or forests.
This powerful melee unit (the Harappan replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Axeman[COLOR_REVERT]) is an excellent defender of cities.

The Anishnaabek replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Musketman[COLOR_REVERT] receives a free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Woodsman[COLOR_REVERT] promotion and an extra movement. They are able to stalk their enemies, watching them from the forests, to attack after extremely quickly, being able to return to the woods where they have a great advantage when defending, before the enemy is able to regroup.
The Croatian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mechanized Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] receives an extra promotion when built.
The Czech Unique Unit, the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hussite[COLOR_REVERT], has two more first strikes.

This unit marks the transition from melee to gunpowder-based cavalry. The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Guard Hussar[COLOR_REVERT] (the Danish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cuirassier[COLOR_REVERT]) is the strongest land unit until the entrance of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]. It also receives an extra bonus against [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cannons[COLOR_REVERT].
Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Code Talkers[COLOR_REVERT] to challenge coastal defences. They are immune to First Strikes and have a slight withdraw chance.

Build this most primitive of the mounted combat units when speed is important but stay on the offensive as it gets no defensive bonuses. This unit is slightly cheaper than the regular [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chariot[COLOR_REVERT] and does not suffer terrain movement penalties.
The Getai's elite shock infantry. The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Drapanai[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Axeman[COLOR_REVERT] and is slightly more cheaper. Use it to counter melee attacks.

This powerful melee unit (the Irish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Light Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) is excellent defending forests and jungles, being able to quickly strike his enemy, then disappear into the woods so fast as they came.
The Finnish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] is more powerful, has bonuses against Early and Light Tanks, and comes with the Woodsman promotion upon completion.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Great Galleas[COLOR_REVERT] serves as an upgraded [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galleass[COLOR_REVERT], though fighting better on coasts.
This powerful melee unit (the Lombard replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Spearman[COLOR_REVERT]) has a general edge against other units because of its extra strength.

The Georgian [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horseman[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT]. Very accustomed to fighting in the rough terrain of their homeland, so they get bonuses when attacking hills and also to defend himself in them.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Gothic Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] replaces [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Light Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] and is very powerful against melee units and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Catapults[COLOR_REVERT].
This powerful gundpowder unit (the Austrian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT]) is an excellent defender against Riflemen.
This powerful Mounted unit (the Pahlavi replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]) gets a Strength bonus.
This powerful gundpowder unit (the Serbian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT]) starts with the Guerilla I and Guerilla II promotions.

This powerful mounted unit (the Polish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cuirassier[COLOR_REVERT]) is excellent against seige weapons and melee infantry, because of its Charge I and Shock I promotions.
Build this melee unit (the Scottish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) for mountainous defense with a slight withdrawal chance.
The tarkan replaces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]horse archer[COLOR_REVERT]. The Tarkans can defeat enemy infantry troops with ease, being able to heal while moving. They are also a bit cheaper than normal.
This powerful mounted (the Hungarian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]), receive two free promotions, Flanking I and Charge I.
The Indonesian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marine[COLOR_REVERT] is weaker, but cheaper and superior in wooded areas.

The Iranian [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Revolutionary Guard[COLOR_REVERT] replaces [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Infantry[COLOR_REVERT], which is great defending cities. They receive the Patrol I promotion and are quite cheaper to build.
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Republican Guards[COLOR_REVERT] are the Iraqi replacements for [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Infantry[COLOR_REVERT]. They receive the Patrol I promotion and are better attacking cities.

Build this moderate-strength gunpowder unit as a counter against mounted enemies like [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]. The Italian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT] is also slightly more powerful than the standard unit and receives a free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Guerilla I[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Iron Helm[COLOR_REVERT] of Kanem-Bornu replaces the traditional Musketman and starts with one first strike and the Drill I promotion, giving them an additional first strike. They are a versatile troops, prepared to stop the enemy before it even gets to fire a single bullet. They are a little weaker than other units of the same type, but they make up this weakness with a much faster recruitment.
The Kazakh replacement for the Knight can move on terrain without penalty.

This powerful mounted unit (the Tibetan replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT]) is excellent when attacking cities. And if the city is heavily defended, can get much benefit looting around.

This powerful melee unit (the Polynesian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) is excellent against melee units and does not require Iron at the minor disadvantage of not gaining city attack bonus.

This powerful mounted unit (the Bulgarian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horseman[COLOR_REVERT]), is capable of traversing land unsuitable for cavalry quickly, so taking advantage over his enemies. Furthermore, can heal while moving.
This powerful mounted unit (the Australian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]), starts with the Mobility promotion.
This powerful melee unit (the Israleli replacement for the Light Swordsman) is excellent defending rough terrain and hills, besides having a bit more strength than other similar units.
The Maghrebi replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] is particularly adept at attacking cities.

Build this powerful early melee combat unit (the Majapahit replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) when you want to attack cities. It is slightly more powerful than the standard unit and receives 1 first strike.
With the ability to defend cities and Hill terrain, the Malagasy replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Pikeman[COLOR_REVERT] is a good defensive unit.
The Cuban [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mambise[COLOR_REVERT] is a unit that has all the advantages of cavalry plus a mobility bonus.

This is the strongest pre-gunpowder unit in the game and are quite effective until [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Grenadiers[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cannon[COLOR_REVERT] begin appearing. The Mande replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] receives a bonus against [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pikemen[COLOR_REVERT].
The Mapuche [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Picunche Warrior[COLOR_REVERT], which replaces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maceman[COLOR_REVERT], and is devastating against gunpowder units.
This powerful mounted unit (the Hurrian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chariot[COLOR_REVERT]) has additional visibility range.
The Egyptian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mailed Knight[COLOR_REVERT]) starts with the Desert Combat I promotion.

This unit marks the transition from melee to gunpowder-based cavalry. The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rurales[COLOR_REVERT] (the Mexican replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cuirassier[COLOR_REVERT]) is the strongest land unit until the entrance of the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]. It is slightly less expensive and receives the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Combat I[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Xifos[COLOR_REVERT] (the Minoan replacement for [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) is available earlier than its generic counterpart and can be built from more materials.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jequetepeque[COLOR_REVERT] (the Moche replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Warrior[COLOR_REVERT]) receives bonuses to attack and defense when fighting in hills.
This powerful mounted unit (the Canadian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mountd rifleman[COLOR_REVERT]), is exceptional when defending cities.
The Mutapa [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rozvi[COLOR_REVERT], which replaces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maceman[COLOR_REVERT], begins with the Flanking I promotion, giving it a chance to withdraw from combat.

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Digger[COLOR_REVERT], New Zealand's replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Infantry[COLOR_REVERT], adds additional defense on hills and cities, as well as well as an additional first strike chance.

Nigeria's [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]NA Artillery[COLOR_REVERT] is cheaper than the traditional [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Artillery[COLOR_REVERT] unit, and starts with the Ambush promotion, making it especially effective against Armored units.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Hersir[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Maceman[COLOR_REVERT], which starts with Looter and March promotions.
The Olmec [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Black Axe[COLOR_REVERT] is faster than other axemen, and receives the Guerilla I promotion, giving it an additional defense bonus on hills.
The Pakistani replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marine[COLOR_REVERT] moves faster and receives two promotions when built.

Build this unit (the Filippino replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT]) to gain an advantage in hills and forests. It receives a first strike chance, besides receiving free Guerilla I and Woodsman I promotions. The Kaputineros are a tenacious fighters, accustomed to fighting in harsh terrain and dense forests and jungles against all those who want to take their territory.

Build this unit (the Phoenician replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Galley[COLOR_REVERT]) to quickly explore your coasts and transport up to 2 land units. They cannot enter ocean spaces but receives both the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Flanking I[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sentry[COLOR_REVERT] promotions.

This powerful melee unit (the Pictish replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Light Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) is excellent defending rough terrains and hills, being able to quickly strike his enemy, then retreat into the hills so fast as they came.
Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ghost Dancers[COLOR_REVERT] to explore territory and accompany other units. These healing units replace [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Explorers[COLOR_REVERT] and cannot attack other units.
The Scythian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horse Archer[COLOR_REVERT] has the ability to attack quickly and withdraw from combat with few casualties if the going gets tough.
Although a little more expensive, this Seljuk replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] unit has increased strength and is great in deserts.

The Guulwadayaal is the Somali replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]SAM Infantry[COLOR_REVERT]. Drawn from the populace, this union is very cheap to huild compared to its counterpart, but it is less powerful and has a smaller chance to intercept.
The South African replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT] starts with a free Commando promotion.

This powerful melee unit (the Cham replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]War Elephant[COLOR_REVERT]) has an edge against units because of its Combat I and Combat II promotion, especially War Elephants against which it has a 50% bonus.

The Swiss replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy Pikeman[COLOR_REVERT] is powerful in hills. Their tactics against cavalry are superior and his military dexterity and intensive training makes it a little stronger than normal. Defend the small Swiss cantons against much higher number enemies requires are well prepared but these benefits are paid expensive, so maintenance is more expensive than average and their recruitment a bit slower.

This powerful melee unit (the Seleukid replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Light Swordsman[COLOR_REVERT]) gets a strength increase and has a bonus when fighting cavalry. Although they cost more to keep
The Timurid replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] gets a bonus in hill terrain.

This melee combat unit gets a big bonus when fighting mounted enemy units. The Trojan replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Pikeman[COLOR_REVERT] is also slightly more powerful than the standard unit and receives a free [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Shock[COLOR_REVERT] promotion.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Tomoi[COLOR_REVERT] (the Tupi replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Scout[COLOR_REVERT]) are even faster, allowing them to cover more ground each turn.

The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Altaic Rider[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the Knight for the Uyghur civilization, and receives both the Guerilla I promotion, additional effectiveness againste Melee units and a chance of a first strike.
This powerful infantry unit (the Romanian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marines[COLOR_REVERT]) has the ability to move through rough terrain with ease.

The large stone chariots of the Vedic civilization - called [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rathins[COLOR_REVERT] - replace the traditional [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Chariot[COLOR_REVERT], and gain both a offensive bonus against Melee units.
This fast moving Vietnamese replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Modern Infantry[COLOR_REVERT] can withdraw from combat and can better defend in hills, jungles and forests.
This powerful mounted unit (the Lithuanian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT]) is especially useful when fighting against mounted units.

This very strong archery unit gets a bonus when defending in cities or on hills. His powerful arrows can penetrate the majority of armors and are able to completely stop charging a cavalry unit, due to its strength and scope.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Jamaican Defense Force[COLOR_REVERT] replaces the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Marine[COLOR_REVERT], and gains both additional movement and the Flanking I promotion.

Build lots of these inexpensive mounted combat units (the Xiongnu replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horseman[COLOR_REVERT]) to have your own personal nomadic horde but stay on the offensive as they get no defensive bonuses.
The Yemeni replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Knight[COLOR_REVERT] can move through all terrains with no penalty.
The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Yoruba[COLOR_REVERT] (the Benin replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Horseman[COLOR_REVERT]) receive the shock-promotion and the flanking I-promotion.
This powerful mounted (the Ukrainian replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Cavalry[COLOR_REVERT]), can move farther than regular cavalry.
